content: cancer charity hat 2016 | my sweet potato 3 p age | 1 of 2 this pattern was designed for the cancer challenge 2016 hosted by sweet potato 3 patterns by downloading this pattern you are pledging to make a minimum of one hat to donate to a cancer patient materials bulky #5 weight yarn 80-100 yards depending on size samples made from red heart reflective other suggested yarn bernat softee baby chunky loops & thread charisma crochet hook k 6 5mm measuring tape yarn needle & scissors stitches / abbreviations used hbhdc = herringbone half_double_crochet* single_crochet = single_crochet chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch st s = stitch es join = join the round with a slip_stitch in the top of the beginning hbhdc or single_crochet of the round r = round / row *herringbone half_double_crochet yarn over insert hook yarn over bring through stitch and 1 loop yarn over bring through 2 loops to complete the stitch gauge check please check gauge for appropriate sizing change hook to correct size to obtain gauge with hook k 9 row with 11 hbhdc = 4 inches square © 2016 my sweet potato 3 do not copy reproduce or publish any part of this document in any form sales of finished product are permitted but please credit my sweet potato 3 with the original pattern design cancer charity hat 2016 | my sweet potato 3 p age | 2 of 2 hat sizing the stitches used for making this hat allow for a lot of stretch so the circumference may be a little smaller than you would typically end with  child about 3-10 years old 16 around & 7 ½ high - fits up to 19 circumference  youth / ladies 17 ½ around & 8 high fits up to 21 circumference  adult / men s 19 around & 8 ½ high fits up to 22 circumference pattern notes  do not count the beginning chain as a stitch  the herringbone half_double_crochet is a loose stitch that allows a lot of stretch when you change to work single crochets make sure you continue to work them loose child hat r1 chain 3 10 hbhdc in 3rd chain from hook join 10 r2 chain 2 2hbhdc in each st around join 20 r3 chain 2 2hbhdc in next st hbhdc in next st repeat around join 30 r4 chain 2 2hbhdc in next st hbhdc in each of the next 2 sts repeat around join 40 gauge check circle should measure 4 ½ across center r5-14 chain 2 hbhdc in each st around join 40 r15-17 chain 1 loosely single_crochet in each st around join 40 after r17 fasten_off and weave in all ends youth / ladies hat r1 chain 3 11 hbhdc in 3rd chain from hook join 11 r2 chain 2 2hbhdc in each st around join 22 r3 chain 2 2hbhdc in next st hbhdc in next st repeat around join 33 r4 chain 2 2hbhdc
